intro: Oxypetalum densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Oxypetalum densiflorum is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
